DataElement.preferredName: RT Fraction Scheme Beam Dose Point Depth Float 16 Character Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The depth (in mm) in the patient along a ray from the source to the dose point specified by the Beam Dose Specification Point (300A,0082). See Note 6.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Fractionation Scheme Beam Dose Point Depth
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Dividing the total dose of radiation therapy into several smaller, equal doses delivered over a period of several days._Scheme; an elaborate and systematic plan of action._A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._The precise location of something; a spatially limited location._Depth; extent downward or inward.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:Dividing the total dose of radiation therapy into several smaller, equal doses delivered over a period of several days.:Scheme; an elaborate and systematic plan of action.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
Radiation therapy in which the total dose delivered is divided into several smaller, equal doses delivered over a period of several days.
An elaborate and systematic plan of action.

Property.preferredDefinition: A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time. :The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.:Depth; extent downward or inward.

Concepts.definition: A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.
The extent downward or inward; the perpendicular measurement from the surface downward to determine deepness.

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/18/19 jk DICOM CDE; Released per qtrly metric review.  11/20/13 created for a Norton CC DICOM RT study. jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: DS: A string of characters representing either a fixed point number or a floating point number. A fixed point number shall contain only the characters 0-9 with an optional leading "+" or "-" and an optional "." to mark the decimal point. A floating point number shall be conveyed as defined in ANSI X3.9, with an "E" or "e" to indicate the start of the exponent. Decimal Strings may be padded with leading or trailing spaces. Embedded spaces are not allowed.  (valid characters 0-9, +,-, E,e,".") [Standard-based]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/27/08 - released post NCIA Interim Rpt Changes;  12/31/07 - chg long & short name to reflect "floating" aspect of value domain as indicated in the definition; semantics and max/min length did not change.  6/8/07-typo in def corrected.  6/4/07-Removed 15 decimal requirement.  5/10/07- Changed long to match Rep term qualifiers.  1/6/07-released VD so it can be reused in other imaging CDE.  1/4/07-2006 DICOM Standard - Sections 5 & 6

ReferenceDocuments.name: DICOM Note
ReferenceDocuments.description: DICOM PS 3.3 - page 657.   Note 6: The values defined by this attribute are related to the gantry angle of the first control point referenced by Referenced Beam Number (300C,0006) of this sequence item.
